page.title: 01Landscape Chillerton I.W.
page.content: This area lies in the centre of the Isle of Wight. It has low rounded hills, small woods and hidden valleys. The Medina stream flows south to north The Downs flank the area to the west and north-east. Some of the soil is chalky and some is sandy-loam. Many of the farms are small and there are cattle as well as different crops in the fields, including vegetables. {There are two small settlements. {Gatcombe nestles in a valley to the {west: Blackwater straddles the Medina {stream in the north-east. Only {the northern part of the villages of {Chillerton and Rookley fall in the {area.}The two main routes run north- south and there are many small lanes with hedgerows and steep flowered banks. Several of the Island Long Distance Trails pass through this lovely countryside.
